problem: Find the angle between the vectors $\begin{pmatrix} 5 \\ -3 \\ -4 \end{pmatrix}$ and $\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ -7 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix},$ in degrees.
solution:
If $\theta$ is the angle between the vectors, then
\[\cos \theta = \frac{\begin{pmatrix} 5 \\ -3 \\ -4 \end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ -7 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix}}{\left\| \begin{pmatrix} 5 \\ -3 \\ -4 \end{pmatrix} \right\| \left\| \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ -7 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix} \right\|} = \frac{(5)(0) + (-3)(-7) + (-4)(-1)}{\sqrt{50} \cdot \sqrt{50}} = \frac{25}{50} = \frac{1}{2}.\]Hence, $\theta = \boxed{60^\circ}.$
